title: 7 Simple Ways to Disconnect Your iPhone from Your Mac

steps.title: Click the Apple menu.
steps.content: Click the Apple menu. This is in the top-left corner. If your iPhone keeps connecting automatically to your Mac, you can disconnect it from your Apple ID. Use this method if you plan to create a new Apple ID to use with your iPhone. Keep in mind that once you remove your iPhone from your Apple ID, it will no longer be able to approve new devices or use Apple services. If you only want to stop syncing photos, navigate to your iCloud settings > Photos > turn off iCloud Photo Library .

steps.title: Click System Settings.
steps.content: Click System Settings . On older devices, this will look like System Preferences . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click your name.
steps.content: Click your name. This will be in the left panel. On older devices, click Apple ID and then Overview .

steps.title: Click your iPhone.
steps.content: Click your iPhone. You'll see this listed under Devices .

steps.title: Click Remove this Device.
steps.content: Click Remove this Device . This is at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Click Confirm.
steps.content: Click Confirm . The iPhone will be removed from the Apple ID associated with your Mac.

steps.title: Open Settings on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open Settings on your iPhone. This is the grey cog icon.

steps.title: Tap Bluetooth.
steps.content: Tap Bluetooth . This is underneath Wi-Fi .

steps.title: Tap the "i" in a circle next to your Mac.
steps.content: Tap the "i" in a circle next to your Mac. A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap Forget This Device.
steps.content: Tap Forget This Device . Your Mac will be unpaired from your iPhone. If needed, you can pair it again .

steps.title: Open Settings on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open Settings on your iPhone. This is the grey cog icon.

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . This is towards the middle of the page.

steps.title: Tap AirDrop.
steps.content: Tap AirDrop . You can find this underneath AppleCare & Warranty .

steps.title: Tap Receiving Off.
steps.content: Tap Receiving Off . You should see a blue checkmark by this option.

steps.title: Open Settings on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open Settings on your iPhone. This is the grey cog icon. Handoff is a feature that lets you begin a task on one Apple device and continue it on another. While this can be helpful in some cases, it may interrupt your workflow if you need to use those devices separately.

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . This is towards the middle of the page.

steps.title: Tap AirPlay & Handoff.
steps.content: Tap AirPlay & Handoff . You can find this underneath AirDrop .

steps.title: Toggle off "Handoff".
steps.content: Toggle off "Handoff". Handoff is now disabled on your iPhone.

steps.title: Launch the Messages app on your Mac.
steps.content: Launch the Messages app on your Mac. Use this method if you don't want your iPhone messages to appear on your Mac.

steps.title: Click Messages.
steps.content: Click Messages . This is in the top toolbar.

steps.title: Click Preferences.
steps.content: Click Preferences . This may also look like Settings .

steps.title: Click iMessage.
steps.content: Click iMessage . This is the section at the top.

steps.title: Click Sign Out.
steps.content: Click Sign Out . A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Click Sign Out again.
steps.content: Click Sign Out again.

steps.title: Launch the FaceTime app on your Mac.
steps.content: Launch the FaceTime app on your Mac. Use this method if you don't want to receive iPhone FaceTime calls on your Mac. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click FaceTime.
steps.content: Click FaceTime . This is in the top toolbar.

steps.title: Click Turn FaceTime Off.
steps.content: Click Turn FaceTime Off . This is at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Open Settings on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open Settings on your iPhone. This is the grey cog icon.

steps.title: Tap Personal Hotspot.
steps.content: Tap Personal Hotspot . You can find this underneath Cellular .

steps.title: Toggle off "Allow Others to Join".
steps.content: Toggle off "Allow Others to Join". This will disconnect your Mac from your iPhone if it's connected via Hotspot .
